{{Virgo}} Virgo 10 is the 262nd day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 10th day of Virgo, and it is a Wednesday. It corresponds to ISO week 38, weekday 3.
Its informal Japanese name is 10宮10日.
On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 262|Chapter 262]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152281}}.
[[Category:Days with weekday Wednesday]] [[Category:Days 10 of the Gaiad calendar]] [[Category:Days of Virgo]] {{DEFAULTSORT:10宮10日}}

{{Virgo}} Virgo 11 is the 263rd day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 11th day of Virgo, and it is a Thursday. It corresponds to ISO week 38, weekday 4.
Its informal Japanese name is 10宮11日.
On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 263|Chapter 263]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152282}}.

{{Virgo}} Virgo 15 is the 267th day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 15th day of Virgo, and it is a Monday. It corresponds to ISO week 39, weekday 1.
Its informal Japanese name is 10宮15日.
On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 267|Chapter 267]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152286}}.

{{Scorpio}} Scorpio 24 is the 332nd day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 24th day of Scorpio, and it is a Wednesday. It corresponds to ISO week 48, weekday 3.
Its informal Japanese name is 12宮24日.
On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 332|Chapter 332]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152351}}.

To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152365}}.

{{Ophiuchus}} Ophiuchus 12 is the 348th day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 12th day of Ophiuchus, and it is a Friday. It corresponds to ISO week 50, weekday 5.

To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152367}}.

{{Ophiuchus}} Ophiuchus 16 is the 352nd day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 16th day of Ophiuchus, and it is a Tuesday. It corresponds to ISO week 51, weekday 2.
Its informal Japanese name is 13宮16日.
On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 352|Chapter 352]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152371}}.

{{Ophiuchus}} Ophiuchus 19 is the 355th day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 19th day of Ophiuchus, and it is a Friday. It corresponds to ISO week 51, weekday 5.
Its informal Japanese name is 13宮19日.
On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 355|Chapter 355]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152374}}.

{{Ophiuchus}} Ophiuchus 26 is the 362nd day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 26th day of Ophiuchus, and it is a Friday. It corresponds to ISO week 52, weekday 5.

On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 362|Chapter 362]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152381}}.

{{Ophiuchus}} Ophiuchus 28 is the 364th day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 28th day of Ophiuchus, and it is a Sunday. It corresponds to ISO week 52, weekday 7.
Its informal Japanese name is 13宮28日.
On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 364|Chapter 364]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152383}}.
[[Category:Days with weekday Sunday]] [[Category:Days 28 of the Gaiad calendar]] [[Category:Days of Ophiuchus]] {{DEFAULTSORT:13宮28日}}

{{Scorpio}} Scorpio 14 is the 322nd day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 14th day of Scorpio, and it is a Sunday. It corresponds to ISO week 46, weekday 7. Its informal Japanese name is 12宮14日. On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 322|Chapter 322]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read. To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152341}}. {{Scorpio}} Scorpio 18 is the 326th day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 18th day of Scorpio, and it is a Thursday. It corresponds to ISO week 47, weekday 4. Its informal Japanese name is 12宮18日. On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 326|Chapter 326]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read. To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152345}}. {{Scorpio}} Scorpio 21 is the 329th day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 21st day of Scorpio, and it is a Sunday. It corresponds to ISO week 47, weekday 7. Its informal Japanese name is 12宮21日. On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 329|Chapter 329]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read. To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152348}}. {{Ophiuchus}} Ophiuchus 21 is the 357th day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 21st day of Ophiuchus, and it is a Sunday. It corresponds to ISO week 51, weekday 7. Its informal Japanese name is 13宮21日. On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 357|Chapter 357]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read. To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152376}}. {{Sagittarius}} Sagittarius 1 is the 1st day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 1st day of Sagittarius, and it is a Monday. It corresponds to ISO week 1, weekday 1.
Its informal Japanese name is 1宮1日.
On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 1|Chapter 1]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152021}}.
[[Category:Days with weekday Monday]] [[Category:Days 1 of the Gaiad calendar]] [[Category:Days of Sagittarius]] {{DEFAULTSORT:01宮01日}}
== Overview == 1st day of the calendar
[[Hatsumōde]]
Hatsuhinode
We celebrate the new year today
Reading the story of [[Aster and Andromeda]]
=== Japanese regular === {| class="wikitable" !Tradition !When !Purpose / Practice |- |'''Hatsumōde''' |Jan 1–3 (or midnight Jan 1) |Shrine/temple visits to pray, buy charms, draw omikuji |- |'''Hatsuhinode''' |Jan 1 sunrise |Welcome the first sunrise to honor Toshigami |- |'''Joya-no-Kane''' |Dec 31 at midnight |Bell ringing for spiritual cleansing |- |'''Ninen-mairi''' |Dec 31 midnight → Jan 1 |Combined New Year’s Eve–Day visit bridging two years |- |'''Dondo-yaki''' |Around Jan 15 (Koshōgatsu) |Bonfire to burn decorations and cherish mochi for health |- |'''Decorations''' |End of December – Early Jan |Kadomatsu, Shime-kazari, Kagami-mochi (with Kagami-biraki) |- |'''Food & Gifting''' |Jan 1 |Osechi dishes, Zōni soup, Otoshidama for children |}
=== Japanese Imperial === Saitan-sai and Shiho-hai
{| class="wikitable" !Ritual / Event !Date(s) !Purpose & Nature |- |'''Ōharae-shiki''' |June 30 & Dec 30 (or Dec 31) |Great Purification — cleanse sins and impurities. Often on New Year’s Eve. |- |'''Joya-sai''' |December 31 |Year-end thanksgiving and reflection. |- |'''Saitan-sai''' |January 1 (dawn) |New Year’s Day Ceremony — pray for peace, prosperity, and Imperial well-being. |- |'''Shiho-hai''' |January 1 (Imperial) |Emperor’s early-year worship at palace shrines. |- |'''Genshi-sai''' |January 3 (Imperial) |Celebrates founding of Imperial lineage; prosperity of nation. |- |'''Sojihajime''' |January 4 (Imperial) |Announcement of yearly ritual schedule. |- |'''Niiname-sai''' |November 23 (Imperial) |Harvest thanksgiving; Emperor offers and consumes new crops. |} [[Category:Dates with custom text]] ===Chapter summary=== Aster, the cosmic catgirl, creates the universe from yarn but longs for companionship. She weaves Andromeda, her counterpart, yet the two are separated by space, their threads forming galaxies. Their love symbolizes the cosmos’ destiny, with hope of reunification at the Omega point in eternal harmony.

To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152022}}.

{{Sagittarius}} Sagittarius 3 is the 3rd day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 3rd day of Sagittarius, and it is a Wednesday. It corresponds to ISO week 1, weekday 3.
Its informal Japanese name is 1宮3日.
On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 3|Chapter 3]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152023}}.
[[Category:Days with weekday Wednesday]] [[Category:Days 3 of the Gaiad calendar]] [[Category:Days of Sagittarius]] {{DEFAULTSORT:01宮03日}}
== Overview == [[:sh:Genshi-sai|Genshi-sai]] {| class="wikitable" !Ritual / Event !Date(s) !Purpose & Nature |- |'''Ōharae-shiki''' |June 30 & Dec 30 (or Dec 31) |Great Purification — cleanse sins and impurities. Often on New Year’s Eve. |- |'''Joya-sai''' |December 31 |Year-end thanksgiving and reflection. |- |'''Saitan-sai''' |January 1 (dawn) |New Year’s Day Ceremony — pray for peace, prosperity, and Imperial well-being. |- |'''Shiho-hai''' |January 1 (Imperial) |Emperor’s early-year worship at palace shrines. |- |'''Genshi-sai''' |January 3 (Imperial) |Celebrates founding of Imperial lineage; prosperity of nation. |- |'''Sojihajime''' |January 4 (Imperial) |Announcement of yearly ritual schedule. |- |'''Niiname-sai''' |November 23 (Imperial) |Harvest thanksgiving; Emperor offers and consumes new crops. |} [[Category:Dates with custom text]] ===Chapter summary=== Aster nurtures creation with her cosmic milk, weaving the Milky Way and imagining children of starlight to guide her love with Andromeda. A pantheon of stars arises: Juno of gas giants, Brunhilda of failed stars, Ruby the enduring red dwarf, Chrystella of main sequence life and decline, Celestella of red supergiants and pulsars, and Gigastella, whose fiery collapse births a black hole. Together, they embody the cycles of stellar life and cosmic destiny.

{{Sagittarius}} Sagittarius 8 is the 8th day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 8th day of Sagittarius, and it is a Monday. It corresponds to ISO week 2, weekday 1. Its informal Japanese name is 1宮8日. On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 8|Chapter 8]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read. To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152028}}. [[Category:Days with weekday Monday]] [[Category:Days 8 of the Gaiad calendar]] [[Category:Days of Sagittarius]] {{DEFAULTSORT:01宮08日}} == Overview == ** ** [[Sagittarius 8]] Coming of Age Day *
[[Category:Dates with custom text]] ===Chapter summary=== Rhodes, son of Ruby, and Marigold, of Chrystella’s line, form the first stellar union. Their love endures through cycles of novas, where Marigold’s fading light passes strength to Rhodes. Together they shine, grow old, and raise children of nebulae. Their legacy becomes enshrined in wedding vows, symbolized by ruby, topaz, and white opal rings—eternal emblems of their cosmic love. == Calculations == === Recent (±10 ISO years) === {| class="wikitable" ! To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152031}}.

{{Sagittarius}} Sagittarius 18 is the 18th day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 18th day of Sagittarius, and it is a Thursday. It corresponds to ISO week 3, weekday 4.
Its informal Japanese name is 1宮18日.
On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 18|Chapter 18]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152038}}.

To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152045}}.

To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152054}}.

{{Capricorn}} Capricorn 7 is the 35th day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 7th day of Capricorn, and it is a Sunday. It corresponds to ISO week 5, weekday 7. Its informal Japanese name is 2宮7日. On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 35|Chapter 35]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read. To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152055}}. [[Category:Days with weekday Sunday]] [[Category:Days 7 of the Gaiad calendar]] [[Category:Days of Capricorn]] {{DEFAULTSORT:02宮07日}} == Overview == ** [[Capricorn 7]] Groundhog day
[[Category:Dates with custom text]] ===Chapter summary=== In the Tommotian age, life diversifies into new lineages. Sponges build reefs through Cyath’s coral cities, while predatory forms like Chondrocles hunt with deadly skill. From Lobopus descend three great houses: Velvetclaw, Waterbear, and Ironfoot. Velvetclaw spawns velvet worms and diverse forms like Hallucigena and Annika; Waterbear’s line endures through Ursus and the tiny yet resilient tardigrades; Ironfoot, through Arthur and Opabinia, gives rise to the arthropods who rule Earth. These innovations reshape creation, founding lasting legacies of reefs, hunters, worms, water bears, and arthropods—defining the Tommotian dawn. == Calculations == === Recent (±10 ISO years) === {| class="wikitable" ! {{Capricorn}} Capricorn 11 is the 39th day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 11th day of Capricorn, and it is a Thursday. It corresponds to ISO week 6, weekday 4.
Its informal Japanese name is 2宮11日.
On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 39|Chapter 39]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152059}}.

{{Capricorn}} Capricorn 13 is the 41st day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 13th day of Capricorn, and it is a Saturday. It corresponds to ISO week 6, weekday 6.
Its informal Japanese name is 2宮13日.
On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 41|Chapter 41]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152061}}.

{{Capricorn}} Capricorn 14 is the 42nd day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 14th day of Capricorn, and it is a Sunday. It corresponds to ISO week 6, weekday 7. Its informal Japanese name is 2宮14日. On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 42|Chapter 42]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read. To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152062}}. To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152068}}.

{{Capricorn}} Capricorn 21 is the 49th day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 21st day of Capricorn, and it is a Sunday. It corresponds to ISO week 7, weekday 7. Its informal Japanese name is 2宮21日. On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 49|Chapter 49]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read. To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152069}}. [[Category:Days with weekday Sunday]] [[Category:Days 21 of the Gaiad calendar]] [[Category:Days of Capricorn]] {{DEFAULTSORT:02宮21日}} == Overview == * Sagittarius ** ** [[Capricorn 21]] [[:Category:Days_that_Kinen-sai_falls_on|Kinen-sai]] official day *
[[Category:Dates with custom text]] ===Chapter summary=== As Stomatos’ sons multiplied across the continents, King Hirnan united them in conquest, seizing land and driving trilobites to their doom. His descendants gave rise to mosses, hornworts, ferns, and flowering plants, but his empire poisoned the seas with phosphorus, causing mass extinctions. The golden Ordovician age ended in devastation as Leviathans, Krakens, and trilobites fell. Yet from ruin arose the Silurian dawn, carrying lessons that greed destroys while harmony and love renew life’s hope. == Calculations == === Recent (±10 ISO years) === {| class="wikitable" ! [[Category:Dates with custom text]] ===Chapter summary=== Arboreus, the settler king, divides the plant world between his sons: Lycos, lord of spores, and Ginkgon, master of megaphylls. From Lycos descend Isolagos with his spore-dividing line, Quill and Sellagine, and Lycopodion, who raised the first scale trees. From Ginkgon’s heir Phyllon come Pteridos, father of ferns and horsetails, and Gymnos, father of trees. Their descendants diversify into quillworts, horsetails, puzzlegrass, whisk ferns, adder’s-tongues, and broad fern dynasties. Arboreus’ legacy establishes the great plant kingdoms that shape forests and prepare the swamps for life’s step onto land.

{{Aquarius}} Aquarius 8 is the 64th day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 8th day of Aquarius, and it is a Monday. It corresponds to ISO week 10, weekday 1.
Its informal Japanese name is 3宮8日.
On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 64|Chapter 64]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152084}}.

{{Aquarius}} Aquarius 24 is the 80th day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 24th day of Aquarius, and it is a Wednesday. It corresponds to ISO week 12, weekday 3.
Its informal Japanese name is 3宮24日.
On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 80|Chapter 80]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152100}}.

{{Aquarius}} Aquarius 28 is the 84th day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 28th day of Aquarius, and it is a Sunday. It corresponds to ISO week 12, weekday 7. Its informal Japanese name is 3宮28日. On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 84|Chapter 84]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read. To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152104}}. [[Category:Days with weekday Sunday]] [[Category:Days 28 of the Gaiad calendar]] [[Category:Days of Aquarius]] {{DEFAULTSORT:03宮28日}} == Overview == [[Aquarius 28]] Easter Sunday 1st Sunday of Easter This is the 1st sunday of easter. Which means the earliest possible sunday easter can happen on. Since we celebrate it as the [[Five Easters]]

{{Pisces}} Pisces 1 is the 85th day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 1st day of Pisces, and it is a Monday. It corresponds to ISO week 13, weekday 1.
Its informal Japanese name is 4宮1日.
On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 85|Chapter 85]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152105}}.

{{Pisces}} Pisces 6 is the 90th day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 6th day of Pisces, and it is a Saturday. It corresponds to ISO week 13, weekday 6.
Its informal Japanese name is 4宮6日.
On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 90|Chapter 90]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152110}}.

{{Pisces}} Pisces 7 is the 91st day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 7th day of Pisces, and it is a Sunday. It corresponds to ISO week 13, weekday 7. Its informal Japanese name is 4宮7日. On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 91|Chapter 91]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read. To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152111}}. {{Pisces}} Pisces 8 is the 92nd day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 8th day of Pisces, and it is a Monday. It corresponds to ISO week 14, weekday 1.
Its informal Japanese name is 4宮8日.
On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 92|Chapter 92]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152112}}.

On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 93|Chapter 93]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152113}}.

{{Pisces}} Pisces 13 is the 97th day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 13th day of Pisces, and it is a Saturday. It corresponds to ISO week 14, weekday 6.
Its informal Japanese name is 4宮13日.
On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 97|Chapter 97]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152117}}.

Its informal Japanese name is 4宮15日.
On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 99|Chapter 99]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152119}}.

{{Pisces}} Pisces 22 is the 106th day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 22nd day of Pisces, and it is a Monday. It corresponds to ISO week 16, weekday 1.
Its informal Japanese name is 4宮22日.
On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 106|Chapter 106]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152126}}.

{{Pisces}} Pisces 24 is the 108th day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 24th day of Pisces, and it is a Wednesday. It corresponds to ISO week 16, weekday 3.

To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152128}}.

{{Pisces}} Pisces 28 is the 112th day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 28th day of Pisces, and it is a Sunday. It corresponds to ISO week 16, weekday 7. Its informal Japanese name is 4宮28日. On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 112|Chapter 112]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read. To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152132}}. [[Category:Days with weekday Sunday]] [[Category:Days 28 of the Gaiad calendar]] [[Category:Days of Pisces]] {{DEFAULTSORT:04宮28日}} == Overview == [[Pisces 28]] 5th Easter Sunday Pisces 28 is the 5th sunday of Easter. So it is the last possible day of Easter. It is also the anniversary of the founding of [[Evolutionism]] in 2011

{{Aries}} Aries 13 is the 125th day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 13th day of Aries, and it is a Saturday. It corresponds to ISO week 18, weekday 6.
Its informal Japanese name is 5宮13日.
On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 125|Chapter 125]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152145}}.

Its informal Japanese name is 6宮2日.
On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 142|Chapter 142]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152162}}.

To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152208}}.

{{Gemini}} Gemini 27 is the 195th day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 27th day of Gemini, and it is a Saturday. It corresponds to ISO week 28, weekday 6.
Its informal Japanese name is 7宮27日.
On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 195|Chapter 195]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152215}}.

{{Leo}} Leo 15 is the 239th day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 15th day of Leo, and it is a Monday. It corresponds to ISO week 35, weekday 1. Its informal Japanese name is 9宮15日. On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 239|Chapter 239]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read. To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152259}}. On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 281|Chapter 281]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152300}}.

{{Libra}} Libra 3 is the 283rd day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 3rd day of Libra, and it is a Wednesday. It corresponds to ISO week 41, weekday 3.
Its informal Japanese name is 11宮3日.
On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 283|Chapter 283]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152302}}.

{{Libra}} Libra 9 is the 289th day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 9th day of Libra, and it is a Tuesday. It corresponds to ISO week 42, weekday 2.
Its informal Japanese name is 11宮9日.
On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 289|Chapter 289]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152308}}.

{{Ophiuchus}} Ophiuchus 3 is the 339th day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 3rd day of Ophiuchus, and it is a Wednesday. It corresponds to ISO week 49, weekday 3.
Its informal Japanese name is 13宮3日.
On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 339|Chapter 339]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152358}}.

To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152360}}.

{{Ophiuchus}} Ophiuchus 9 is the 345th day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is the 9th day of Ophiuchus, and it is a Tuesday. It corresponds to ISO week 50, weekday 2.
Its informal Japanese name is 13宮9日.
On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 345|Chapter 345]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152364}}.

{{Horus}} Horus 1 is the 365th day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is an intercalary day, the 1st of the 7 days of Horus. It falls on a Monday in intercalary week 53.
Its informal Japanese name is 14宮1日.
On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 365|Chapter 365]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152384}}.

{{Horus}} Horus 2 is the 366th day of the year in the [[Gaiad calendar]]. It is an intercalary day, the 2nd of the 7 days of Horus. It falls on a Tuesday in intercalary week 53.
Its informal Japanese name is 14宮2日.
On this day, [[Gaiad chapter 366|Chapter 366]] of the [[Gaiad]] is read.
To see structured data on this date see {{q|Q152385}}.
